lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Hi there. What brings you in today?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I've been having stomach pain and bloating for about three weeks. It's getting worse.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Where exactly is the pain?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Upper part of my stomach, sometimes it moves to the right side.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Is the pain constant or does it come and go?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: It comes and goes. Worst after big meals or fatty foods.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Some nausea after meals. No vomiting but loose stools three or four times a week.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any blood in your stool?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: No, nothing like that.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any heartburn or acid reflux?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Yes, burning sensation in my chest after eating, especially when I lie down.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: What's your diet like?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: A lot of fast food and spicy food. Coffee in the morning and soda all day.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any medications?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: Daily aspirin for my heart, and Tums almost every day for the past two weeks.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Any weight loss?

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: About 5 pounds in the last month without trying.

lines.speaker: Provider
lines.text: Let me do an abdominal exam.

lines.speaker: Patient
lines.text: I hope it's nothing serious.
